derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'relating to music, musical'): via Latin from Greek harmonikos, from harmonia (see harmony)

entry.def: Harmonic means composed, played, or sung using two or more notes which sound right and pleasing together.

example.ex: I had been looking for ways to combine harmonic and rhythmic structures.
example.tran: 我过去一直在寻找将和声和节奏结合起来的方法。

entry.def: Harmonics are musical notes which can be produced on certain instruments. Harmonics are higher and quieter than the main note being played.

means.word_mean: 1. a tone that is a component of a complex sound
1. of or relating to harmony as distinct from melody and rhythm;

sentences.sentence: "subtleties of harmonic change and tonality"- Ralph Hill

means.word_mean: 2. of or relating to the branch of acoustics that studies the composition of musical sounds;

sentences.sentence: "the sound of the resonating cavity cannot be the only determinant of the harmonic response"

means.word_mean: 3. relating to vibrations that occur as a result of vibrations in a nearby body;
